attributes.title: Physical stock take
attributes.recommendation: The branch management should put more controls to ensure parallel records between the physical inventory balances and those recorded in SAP.
attributes.effect: The discrepancies noted in stock movement records indicate potential weakness in stock movement controls and this should be worked on.

value: We will minimize variations by conducting regular stock takes.
Manager has to compare physical and SAP quantity daily to avoid variation in future.

In the prior audit report dated 5 27 March 2025 stock variances were as seen below:

ü  Polybags had +230 pieces.

ü  Finished product had -27 pieces.

ü  Yeast had+0.15 sachets.

Utto had -1.03

 

White flour had+7.45 Kgs
Current
Operations/Production Department

attributes.title: Cash Verification
attributes.recommendation: Cash controls are working effectively to be maintained.
attributes.effect: Immaterial variation of +1 noted indicates that cash controls in the branch are working effectively.

value: We will maintain cash controls
Noted.
In the prior audit report dated 27th March 2027, it was noted that cash had nil variation.
Current
Operations/Production Department

attributes.title: Bread weight analysis.
attributes.recommendation: Branch management should ensure standard dough weight and improve on slicers’ efficiencies to minimize cases of underweight Bread.
attributes.effect: Non-compliance with weight standards can result in regulatory issues, customer dissatisfaction and reputational risks.

value: Underweights were caused by overcooling we will push slicers to achieve efficiency to minimize, and we will also put more controls to ensure correct production procedures are followed.
Advice to the manager to avoid over cooling as well needs to check the dough weight to make sure the divider is cutting proper dough weight.
There was compliance especially in 600g Bt (73%) and 800g Ct (76%) and all other varieties whose average
Current
Operations/Production Department

attributes.title: Bread damages Percentage Analysis
attributes.recommendation: Branch management to maintain and improve further by strictly enhancing supervision in production area to ensure production workers are strictly complying with correct production procedures.
attributes.effect: Less damages within the allowable threshold indicates proper bread handling hence less deformities.

value: We will ensure correct production process is followed to ensure damages are within the limits.
Noted will maintain the same.
Current

attributes.title: Production Damages
attributes.recommendation: The branch management should ensure hiring of workers is done as per the shift targets.
attributes.effect: Production efficiency was not achieved, 21 extra packers were hired with a cost implication of Kshs 22,818.60.

value: We shall try to attain production target by ensuring targets are achieved by ShiftWise to minimize the issue of excess employees hired.
Production efficiency was not attained due to the frequent breakdown of ovens, but we will try to improve by arranging preventive maintenance schedule.
In the prior audit report dated 27th March 2025, it was noted that production efficiency was at 4.26 bags per production workers,8extra workers were hired with a cost of Kshs.8,692.8
Current

attributes.title: Packing efficiency
attributes.recommendation: To optimize operations, branch management is advised to match hiring decisions with current work load levels.
attributes.effect: Overstaffing points to flaws in workforce planning and resource management, causing extra operational costs that could be avoided.

value: We shall try to ensure efficiency is achieved by monitoring shift wise targets to be achieved.
we shall monitor on the same to avoid extra cost by hiring extra people in future
The previous audit report dated 27th March 2025 indicated a packing efficiency of 90.02 crates per packer.
Current
Operations/Production Department

attributes.title: Mixing Chart analysis.
attributes.recommendation: Sales team to review and optimize sales routes to ensure efficient delivery and broader coverage.
attributes.effect: Only 82.45% of the daily production goal was achieved, indicating that current capacity is not being fully utilized. This was mainly due to low sales and issues related to balance control.

value: .

attributes.title: Mini shop Spot Check.
attributes.recommendation: The management should maintain the Mini shop controls.

value: We will maintain Mini shop controls

attributes.title: Debtors’ Analysis
attributes.effect: Delayed actions on overdue unsecured debts may result in the accumulation of bad debts impacting financial stability and operational efficiency.

value: Sales rep is following up on the debts to be cleared.
Will be following up with sales team
The previous audit noted that most routes had zero balances and prepaid balances while other routes had minimal balances.

attributes.title: Vehicles Fuel Consumption Analysis.
attributes.recommendation: Branch management should strictly allocate fuel as per the standard kilometers covered

value: We Will be checking with KAF.

In the previous       audit it was found that overall fuel consumption for most route vehicles was within the set standard. However, certain vehicles specifically on the Kawangware, Nkoroi and Southland 1 routes exhibited fuel overconsumption leading to additional costs.
